Today on the Ticker

Bush urges 15 nations to set global emissions
goal

WASHINGTON (AP) -- President Bush,
seeking to blunt international criticism of the U.S. record on
climate change, on Thursday urged 15 major nations to agree by
the end of next year on a global target for reducing greenhouse
gases.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/05/31/bush.climate.ap/index.html

***

Plame sues CIA over
spy memoir

WASHINGTON (AP) -- Valerie Plame,
the former undercover CIA officer whose 2003 exposure touched
off a leak investigation, is accusing the government of
delaying publication of her new book.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/plame-sues-cia-over-spy-memoir.html

***

U.S. attorney connected to firings resigns

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The man whose appointment as an
interim U.S. attorney in Arkansas helped prompt the controversy
regarding the firing of federal prosecutors has announced he
will leave his job effective Friday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/us-attorney-connected-to-firings.html

***

Source: Nagin considering gubernatorial
bid

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- New Orleans Mayor Ray
Nagin is seriously considering a Louisiana gubernatorial bid, a
political intimate of Nagin tells CNN.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/source-nagin-considering-gubernatorial.html

***

Edwards unveils plan to reduce gas
prices

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- In a response to
skyrocketing gas prices, former North Carolina Sen. John
Edwards will introduce a plan meant to reduce energy costs and
create more energy-efficient vehicles at a press conference in
Menlo Park, California Thursday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/edwards-unveils-plan-to-reduce-gas.html

***

Dodd touts energy plan in new ad

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Sen. Chris Dodd, D-Connecticut, is out
with a new campaign ad Thursday that highlights his call for a
corporate carbon tax to fight global warming.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/dodd-touts-energy-plan-in-new-ad.html

***

McCain to take immigration issue head on day before
debate

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Sen. John McCain,
R-Arizona, plans to deliver an address on the heated topic of
immigration next Monday, his presidential campaign announced
today.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/mccain-to-take-immigration-issue-head.html

***

Wal-Mart targets southerners and
Republicans

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
WakeUpWalMart.com, an Internet-based organization aiming to
improve Wal-Mart business practices, has recently announced a
new advertising campaign aimed at Southerners and conservative
Republicans.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/wal-mart-targets-southerners-and.html

***

Schneider: Can Thompson play the role of
Reagan?

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- With 10
Republicans already running for president, is it too late for
former Sen. Fred Thompson to get into this race? Not if he
brings something other candidates don't.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/schneider-can-thompson-play-role-of.html

***

Thompson: Do more to stop Iran

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- On the same day "Law and Order" star
Fred Thompson inched one step closer to a presidential run, the
former senator was on a popular conservative Web site slamming
the Palestinian group Hamas and calling on the world to do more
to stop Iran's nuclear program.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/thompson-do-more-to-stop-iran.html

***

IRS warns of scam e-mail attack

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The Internal Revenue Service is warning
businesses across the country of two new and potentially
devastating e-mail scams which could silently take over their
computer hard drives.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/irs-warns-of-scam-e-mail-attack.html

***

Ahead on CNN

Raw Politics
tonight: The gold rush is on

Republican and
Democratic contenders are storming the Golden State looking for
endorsements, bumps in the polls, and money, money, money. From
the hills of Hollywood to the San Francisco Bay, the
battleground is being plundered, CNN's Tom Foreman reports.

Also, the president and Putin, planning their summer
getaway; and the big name friend of Bill-and-Hill is who is
going GOP.

Catch it all on "Raw Politics," tonight on
Anderson Cooper 360, 10 p.m. ET
